titles.title: Petrified Forest National Park Expansion Act of 2003
Petrified Forest National Park Expansion Act of 2004
Petrified Forest National Park Expansion Act of 2004
Petrified Forest National Park Expansion Act of 2004
To revise the boundary of the Petrified Forest National Park in the State of Arizona, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-713.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 435.

action.text: Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1630.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Renzi asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

reference.label: text as House agreed to Senate amendment

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 12/3/2004--Public Law. Petrified Forest National Park Expansion Act of 2004 - Revises the boundaries of the Petrified Forest National Park in Arizona. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire private and State lands within in the Park's revised boundary to be administered as part of the Park.Directs the Secretary to transfer to the National Park Service (NPS) administrative jurisdiction over any land under the Secretary's jurisdiction that: (1) is within the Park's boundaries; and (2) is not under the NPS's administrative jurisdiction.Permits the continuation of grazing on land transferred to the Secretary.Requires the Secretary to amend the general management plan for the Park to address the use and management of any additional land acquired under this Act.
